class.name: XMLParser
class.brief_description: Low-level class for creating parsers for [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XML]XML[/url] files.
class.description: This class can serve as base to make custom XML parsers. Since XML is a very flexible standard, this interface is low-level so it can be applied to any possible schema.

method.name: get_attribute_count
method.description: Gets the amount of attributes in the current element.

method.name: get_attribute_name
method.description: Gets the name of the attribute specified by the index in [code]idx[/code] argument.

method.name: get_attribute_value
method.description: Gets the value of the attribute specified by the index in [code]idx[/code] argument.

method.name: get_current_line
method.description: Gets the current line in the parsed file (currently not implemented).

method.name: get_named_attribute_value
method.description: Gets the value of a certain attribute of the current element by name. This will raise an error if the element has no such attribute.

method.name: get_named_attribute_value_safe
method.description: Gets the value of a certain attribute of the current element by name. This will return an empty [String] if the attribute is not found.

method.name: get_node_data
method.description: Gets the contents of a text node. This will raise an error in any other type of node.

method.name: get_node_name
method.description: Gets the name of the current element node. This will raise an error if the current node type is neither [constant NODE_ELEMENT] nor [constant NODE_ELEMENT_END].

method.name: get_node_offset
method.description: Gets the byte offset of the current node since the beginning of the file or buffer.

method.name: get_node_type
method.description: Gets the type of the current node. Compare with [enum NodeType] constants.

method.name: has_attribute
method.description: Check whether the current element has a certain attribute.

method.name: is_empty
method.description: Check whether the current element is empty (this only works for completely empty tags, e.g. [code]<element \>[/code]).

method.name: open
method.description: Opens an XML file for parsing. This returns an error code.

method.name: open_buffer
method.description: Opens an XML raw buffer for parsing. This returns an error code.

method.name: read
method.description: Reads the next node of the file. This returns an error code.

method.name: seek
method.description: Moves the buffer cursor to a certain offset (since the beginning) and read the next node there. This returns an error code.

method.name: skip_section
method.description: Skips the current section. If the node contains other elements, they will be ignored and the cursor will go to the closing of the current element.

constants.constant: There's no node (no file or buffer opened).
